result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

(Cases 22CF683, 22CF1093 are called at 11:12 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Julie A Pankratz appeared by phone. Attorney Lester Liptak appeared by video separately on behalf of Attorney Karl A Schmidt.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF683- Court advises the Defendant charges and potential penalties. Defendant enters Not Guilty pleas. Court receives Not Guilty Pleas. 
22CF1093- Court to schedule out of intake Preliminary Hearing. 
Status Conference in 22CF683 and Preliminary Hearing in 22CF1093: 12/22/2022 at 2:30 PM.
Arraignment on October 14, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Arraignment on October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Same as Complaint

3:38 PM Cases called: 22CF1093 and 22CF683.  Defendant Julie A Pankratz in court.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Julie A Pankratz.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF1093: Waives reading of the complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived and bond is set. 

22CF683: State calls Deputy Kory Brock, Eau Claire County Sheriff's Office to the stand; sworn and testifies. Witness identifies the Defendant and the record will so reflect. Cross examination by Defense. 

RECALLED: 3:49pm Same appearances. Witness steps down. 

State requests bind over. Defense reserves argument based on the standards of todays hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over to Judge Barna for scheduling. 22CF1093 will ride along for scheduling.
